panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together
panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: Average system load for the last minute
panels.title: System Load (1M)

panels.description: Average system load for the last 5 minutes
panels.title: System Load (5M)

panels.description: Average system load for the last 15 minutes
panels.title: System Load (15M)

targets.expr: max by (instance) (100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/opt/dock-schedule", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/opt/dock-schedule", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"}) or 100 - ((node_filesystem_avail_bytes{mountpoint="/", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"} * 100) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"}))

max by (instance) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/opt/dock-schedule", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"} or node_filesystem_size_bytes{mountpoint="/", fstype!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node", job="$job"})

panels.description: Total number of containers running on the host. If 2 are running then it is mostly likely the scraping containers and the host is not being utilized for cluster jobs. If less than 2 are running then there is most likely a problem occurring with the container services, the host services or the host itself.
panels.title: Containers

panels.description: Busy state of the system CPUs together
panels.title: CPU Busy

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: The average write time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.
panels.title: Average Write Wait Time

panels.description: The average read time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.
panels.title: Average Read Wait Time

panels.description: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device
panels.title: Average Queue Size

panels.description: Disk space used of all mounted filesystems
panels.title: Disk Space Used

panels.description: Transmitted network traffic for found interfaces
panels.title: Transmitted Data

panels.description: Received network traffic for found interfaces
panels.title: Received Data

panels.description: Packets processed by softnet- Kernel high speed network traffic handler
panels.title: Softnet Packets Processed

panels.description: Packets dropped by softnet- Kernel high speed network traffic handler. Dropped packets are an indicator the kernel could not keep up with the network load.
panels.title: Softnet Packets Dropped

panels.description: Squeezed packets by softnet- Kernel high speed network traffic handler. An increase of squeezed counters indicate the CPU had to interrupt processing the network packets due to time budget constraints, network packet processing is falling behind.
panels.title: Softnet Squeezed

panels.description: ARP entries for found interfaces. Mapping of IP addresses to MAC addresses.
panels.title: ARP Entries
